Jim Gilbert wrote:
> My guess is that this technique was a way to
> put a uniform matte finish on the gold so that
> it wasn't too showy.  I doubt that it was for
> friction, since if it was why not treat the shakudo
> pieces the same way?  Maybe it also helps to
> make small scratches and dings in the gold
> surface from wear less obvious.
>Other ideas?

I have wondered the same thing.  Why?  When?  What is it?  Is it simply rain??
Like we see in ukiyoe - wind driving rain, a la osujikai yaurime on nakago???

Barry Thomas.
